title: Regression in spack, nothing is installable as spack always asks for pkgconf
body:
nothing is installable as spack always asks for pkgconf.

### Expected Result

```
spack spec vim
```

Should show something meaningful...

### Actual Result

What happened instead

```
$ spack spec vim
Input spec
--------------------------------
vim

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: Package pkgconfig not found.
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

git checkout on 02371d2ace7c366f0b0b6332010323d478bc7652 (the latest develop branch as of this ticket) and run the above

### Information on your system

centos7 with

packages.yaml
```
packages:
  cuda:
    version: [8.0.61, 8.0.44]
  cudnn:
    version: [5.1, 6.0]
  gcc:
    version: [6.3.0]
    variants: ~binutils
  hwloc:
    variants: +cuda
  llvm:
    version: [3.9.1]
  octave:
    variants: +curl+fftw+arpack+gnuplot+suitesparse+zlib+llvm
  openmpi:
    version: [1.10.6]
    variants: +cuda +slurm
  python:
    version: [3.4.3]
```

modules.yaml
```
modules:
  tcl:
    all:
      suffixes:
        '^python@3': python3
        '^python@2': python2
```
